name: VLOOKUP
summary: Looks for a value in the leftmost column of a table and returns a value in the same row from a column you specify.
best_practice: Always use FALSE (0) for exact match unless the data is sorted and you specifically need approximate match.

parameters.name: lookup_value
parameters.desc: The value you want to look up.

parameters.name: table_array
parameters.desc: The range where the lookup value is located.

parameters.name: col_index_num
parameters.desc: The column number in the range that contains the return value.

parameters.name: [range_lookup]
parameters.desc: TRUE (1) for approximate match, FALSE (0) for exact match.

name: IF
summary: Checks whether a condition is met, and returns one value if TRUE, and another value if FALSE.
best_practice: For multiple conditions, consider using IFS (Excel 2019+) instead of nested IFs.

parameters.name: logical_test
parameters.desc: The condition you want to test.

parameters.name: value_if_true
parameters.desc: The value to return if the condition is TRUE.

parameters.name: [value_if_false]
parameters.desc: The value to return if the condition is FALSE.

name: SUMIF
summary: Adds the cells specified by a given criteria.
best_practice: Use wildcard characters (*, ?) for partial matching in criteria.

parameters.name: range
parameters.desc: The range of cells you want evaluated by criteria.

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.desc: The condition that defines which cells will be added.

parameters.name: [sum_range]
parameters.desc: The actual cells to add, if different from range.
